intro: Heliophila alpina, commonly known as alpine heliophila, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and typically grows in moist, rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are often blue or purple in color, which bloom during the summer months. Heliophila alpina is adapted to cold climates and can thrive in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in alpine meadows and tundra regions.
